history.content:
Hi I know this question has been asked multiple times but I wanted to know

So I was thinking of taking Cs189 next semester under Shewchuk who I know had taught the course before it became more theoretical in nature so I was wondering the following because I have heard from Sahai's post that ee126 and 127 are useful for 189 :

I am taking Math 110 right now and I really like it (prolly one of my favorite classes here) and I feel relatively comfortable with Linear Algebra and plan to take future math courses, and Ive heard that 127 is very similar to 110 but more "applied" in a sense, so I was wondering if taking 127 would be absolutely "essential" for 189 or if I could self-learn the "applied" concepts of 127. 

If I do plan on taking CS189 next semester, then for sure I plan on co-taking that with EE126 as my probability skills need alot of working on. But yea, I was just wondering if taking 127 was ABSOLUTELY necessary to having a key understanding of the material or not.

Furthermore, as is common with Berkeley students, I too am looking for internships this summer and plan to apply to get them, however I do not feel as if I have many "employable" skills so I was wondering if taking 189 would help with that, or would taking a class like CS186 be more fruitful?

All comments and replies are appreciated :)

If you read this long, thank you!
history.subject: CS189
